title: Visakhapatnam Steel Plant will not be privatised, says Nara Lokesh
content: The IT Minister credits the double-engine government for supporting the plant’s revival, and highlights new investments and job creation initiatives in the State

title: School students to compete for ₹1 crore prize money pool in Viksit Bharat Buildathon contest
content: Two-hour livestreamed innovation event on October 13; students asked to ideate and build prototypes by end of October; winners to be announced at district, State, national levels

title: Telangana seeks 70% share in Krishna water allocated to combined A.P.
content: Minister for Irrigation Uttam Kumar Reddy says strong arguments were placed before KWDT-II with scientific data

title: Palakkad Victoria College unveils fascinating world of botany
content: Govt. Victoria College’s Botany Department is conducting an exhibition as part of its platinum jubilee celebrations

title: Devotees flock to Indrakeeladri for darshan of Gayatri Devi on second day of Dasara festivities
content: The ₹500-ticket queue lines wore a deserted look, while the figures for ₹300 and ₹100 tickets stood at 2,998 and 3,162 respectively

title: Homestays in Kerala to display QR code to verify classification rating
content: Scanning the QR code will take tourists to the official website of Kerala Tourism if it is an approved and classified one

title: Vizhinjam scripts new milestone by berthing MSC Verona with a draft of 17.1 m
content: The landmark event also coincided with MSC Verona becoming the 500th vessel to be berthed at Vizhinjam — a remarkable achievement within just 10 months of commercial operations, which began in December 2024.

title: High-security drill conducted ahead of Vice-President, CM visit to Tirumala
content: Police secure entire route from Renigunta airport to Tirumala hilltop; anti-sabotage, bomb disposal, and special squads deployed to ensure safe passage for VVIPs

title: Dharmasthala case: Activist Mahesh Shetty Thimarody externed to Raichur district for one year
content: Puttur Assistant Commissioner passes immediate orders as more number of cases were booked against Thimarody when externment proceedings were on

title: Kerala University senate meeting on November 1
content: As the last meeting was held on June 17, the next one should have been conducted by October 16 as per the Kerala University Act, prompting accusations over a possible breach of statutory norms.

title: ‘Kantara: A Legend Chapter 1’: Near-death experiences, sleep nights... Rishab Shetty on his biggest film yet
content: At a recent media interaction, Rishab Shetty opened up on the journey of making the highly anticipated prequel ‘Kantara: A Legend Chapter 1,’ though consciously refraining from revealing details about the plot

title: High Caesarean deliveries in A.P. a concern, muhurtham surgeries not right, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: Chief Minister tells Health Minister to engage with private hospitals and ensure that surgeries are performed only when medically required, and natural deliveries are prioritised

title: Some farmers groups demand reopening of private farm produce market in Belagavi
content: MLA joins protest saying farmers should be given a choice as to where they will sell their produce and where they get better prices

title: 40-year-old man sentenced to double life term for sexually assaulting 91-year-old, robbing her of gold chain
content: The elderly victim died within eight months of the incident. Biju, alias Vijayakumar, the convict, belongs to Alathur in Palakkad district

title: Man wanted in 80 robbery cases in five States escapes police custody in A.P.
content: The undertrial prisoner flees while being taken to Rajamahendravaram Central Prison after a court hearing in Vijayawada; two policemen suspended

title: Elephant ‘Radhakrishnan’ captured by T.N. Forest Department in the Nilgiris
content: The elephant will be taken to a specially-constructed kraal (elephant shelter) in the core area of the Mudumalai Tiger Reserve, where it is to be held for a period of time prior to being released, say officials

title: Panel formed to resolve salary and staff pattern issues in Thrissur Corporation’s Electricity department
content: Committee will have representatives of employees and government, and is tasked with submitting its report by October 31

title: Tamil Nadu political party VCK expanding its presence in tea plantation sector in Idukki
content: Party plans to contest in nine grama panchayats under the Peerumade Assembly constituency in the upcoming local body polls

title: Hyderabad to welcome 350th Shaheedi Shatabdi Nagar Kirtan Yatra on September 25
content: Procession aims to spread awareness of ninth Sikh Guru Tegh Bahadur’s supreme sacrifice and timeless teachings

title: Restore roads, give relief to rain-hit people or face protest, AIKS tells State govt.
content: Bus services to 25 villages have remained suspended for the past four days after the collapse of a bridge in Kalaburagi district

title: Thazhathangadi Boat race on September 27
content: The snakeboats that secured the top nine positions in the Nehru Trophy Boat Race will participate in this event of the Champions Boat League

title: Maintain distance from Garba pandals, Chhattisgarh Waqf Board chief tells Muslim youth
content: Waqf board chairman Salim Raj says he had issued the statement in official capacity and that it was an appeal and not an order; points out that ‘Garba is not a dance floor’ but a matter of faith

title: GST reforms to benefit 90% of households, says Lanka Dinakar
content: The government will launch awareness drives on GST reforms through Chartered Accountants, chambers, and voluntary bodies

title: Lokesh dares Opposition to debate fee reimbursement arrears in Andhra Pradesh
content: HRD Minister accuses YSRCP of leaving ₹4,000 crore unpaid, adding that the TDP-led coalition has released ₹1,200 crore this year and will clear the remaining ₹1,400 crore within three months.

title: PM Modi to release ₹7,500 crore for 75 lakh women under Rozgar Yojana
content: First instalment of ₹10,000 each to be transferred in Bihar on September 26; additional ₹2 lakh grant after performance review

title: Influx of exotic species threatening local ecology, warn experts
content: Experts warn that in the absence of natural predators, the exotic species might thrive and compete with local fauna for resources

title: Officials told to ensure relief, precautionary measures as Kalaburagi faces floods
content: The district in-charge Minister says heavy downpour over the past three days has worsened the situation, necessitating urgent relief measures

title: Buggana accuses Andhra Pradesh government of misleading Assembly on State borrowings
content: Former Finance Minister cites CAG data showing liabilities of ₹55,901 crore, contradicting government’s claim of ₹35,305 crore

title: ED attaches ₹7.44 crore assets of companies ‘beneficially owned’ by AAP’s Satyendar Jain
content: It has been alleged that the former Delhi Minister acquired assets disproportionate to his known sources of income

title: Andhra Pradesh launches ₹5,500-crore power projects to boost supply, ease overloads
content: The State is fast-tracking new substations and grid upgrades to meet rising electricity demand, with the SCADA centre in Visakhapatnam enabling real-time monitoring, says Energy Minister

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: ED aids Mauritius in building capacity to combat money laundering
content: A training programme at Port Louis is part of an MoU to intensify bilateral cooperation against financial crimes

title: Jeff Passan's 2025 MLB regular-season awards
content: Forget the MVP and Cy Young Award races -- it's time for our fun and wide-ranging regular-season annual accolades.

title: Ravens' Henry baffled by third fumble in 3 games
content: Running back Derrick Henry's third fumble in three games played a pivotal role in the Baltimore Ravens' 38-30 loss to the Detroit Lions Monday night. He told reporters after the defeat that "I'm at a loss for words. ... I ain't going to lie to y'all."

title: U.S. stars: We're giving Ryder Cup pay to charity
content: Scottie Scheffler and several of his U.S. teammates said they are planning to donate their entire Ryder Cup stipend to charity.

title: With walk-off win, Padres head back to playoffs
content: The Padres clinched their fourth playoff berth in six seasons with a 5-4, 11-inning win against the Brewers on Monday night.

title: Sources: VanVleet has torn ACL, may miss season
content: Rockets star guard Fred VanVleet suffered a torn ACL during a recent workout and could potentially miss the entirety of the 2025-26 season, sources told ESPN.

title: Pearl steps down after 11 seasons at Auburn
content: Bruce Pearl has stepped down as the men's hoops coach at Auburn and will move into an ambassador's role in the athletic department as special assistant to the athletics director, the school announced Monday.

title: Baumgardner title fight on Paul-Davis undercard
content: Alycia Baumgardner will defend her junior lightweight titles as part of the undercard for the Nov. 14 exhibition boxing match between Jake Paul and Gervonta Davis, Most Valuable Promotions announced Tuesday.

title: Falcons fire WR coach Hilliard after offense flops
content: The Falcons fired wide receivers coach Ike Hilliard on Monday, one day after being routed by the Panthers, the team announced.

title: Cowboys' Jones: IR a consideration for WR Lamb
content: Cowboys Pro Bowl wide receiver CeeDee Lamb could miss three to four weeks because of a high left ankle sprain suffered in Sunday's loss to the Bears, according to a source.

title: 📈 NFL Power Rankings: Defensive issues
content: We stacked every NFL team ahead of Week 4. Who jumped up our 1-32 list? Plus, let's pick out the biggest defensive concerns for each roster.

title: NBA Rank 2025 is here! Which players made the cut in Nos. 100 to 51
content: We're counting down the top 100 players in the league for the 2025-26 season. What players broke into Nos. 100 to 51?

title: NBA Rank: Which 10 players can make a jump into the top 100 next year?
content: ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton takes a look at which players could join the list next season after falling short this year.

title: College Football Playoff Bubble Watch: Breaking down every conference
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: Ranking every player in the 2025 Ryder Cup, from Scheffler to McIlroy to Højgaard
content: Team USA and Europe will meet at Bethpage Black for Ryder Cup bragging rights. We're breaking down every player competing in this year's tournament.

title: Lions use dominant rushing attack, relentless pass rush to grab big road win
content: Detroit overwhelmed Baltimore at the line of scrimmage to pull away for a big early-season road victory.

title: 'Everybody's waiting for that moment': Ohtani gets set for his first two-way October
content: Whether he starts Game 1 on the mound or pitches in relief, Shohei Ohtani is primed to make even more history.

title: Battle for the AL Central: Breaking down an improbable Guardians comeback and epic Tigers collapse﻿
content: With a week left, Detroit and Cleveland are separated by one game atop the division -- and the race might fall among the greatest finishes of all time.

title: Way-Too-Early Bracketology: Can Ryan Odom bring success back to Virginia, ACC?
content: The new Cavaliers coach is tasked with winning as big as the coach he once beat in a historic upset. Can it be done in Year 1?

title: What Bruce Pearl's retirement means for Auburn, college basketball
content: The Tigers' winningest coach is retiring. Here's what that means with 42 days until the 2025-26 season.

title: 'We got that vibe about us': Inside the StudBudz WNBA takeover
content: With pink hair, lively banter and bold basketball, Courtney Williams and Natisha Hiedeman champion Black, gay, masc representation in the WNBA.

title: Kelsey Mitchell continues to fuel Fever's WNBA playoff run
content: After enduring six losing seasons, Kelsey Mitchell has led Indiana to its first WNBA semifinals since 2015.

title: Big questions: Have Lions' coordinators found their groove? How concerning is Cowboys' D?
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game.

title: Pickups: Trey Benson next man up; Raiders' offense still has value
content: Highlighting available free agent options after yet another injury-filled weekend, as well as other helpful options ahead of Week 4.

title: Offseason survey: Best and worst moves, LeBron's future and Finals picks
content: League insiders share their picks for the Finals, most head-scratching moves of the summer and LeBron's next decision.

title: From designer clutches to grocery bags: Inside soccer's toiletry bag obsession
content: Toiletry bags are soccer players' fashion statements, and the stars of MLS opened theirs up and showed ESPN what's inside.

title: Why Dembélé's Ballon d'Or win over Yamal feels like the dawn of a new era
content: Ousmane Dembélé and Lamine Yamal, this year's top two in the Ballon d'Or voting, have a lot in common when it comes to how their energetic, attacking play is a welcome antidote in the tactics-driven world of modern soccer.

title: Men's divisional rankings: Liam Paro wins, enters welterweight rankings
content: Liam Paro cracks the top 10 in a new division following a decision win over David Papot. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Women's divisional rankings: Kaye Scott enters top 5 at 160 pounds
content: Kaye Scott makes her debut at middleweight, and Jelena Mrdjenovich enters the top 5 at junior featherweight.

title: MLS: How high can LAFC climb with Son leading a dynamic attack?
content: Pairing Son Heung-min with Denis Bouanga has given LAFC one of the most fearsome attacks in the league, but were they able to break into the top five of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings?

title: NWSL: Marta's Orlando Pride in nine-game rut
content: Orlando have stretched their winless rut to a calamitous nine straight games and are desperately clinching on to a playoff position. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: College football betting: Is it time to buy into Fernando Mendoza and the Hoosiers?
content: As the odds shift each week for the coveted Heisman Trophy and national championship, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet each of them.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Vinícius Jr's future at Madrid in doubt
content: Vinícius Júnior's future at Real Madrid reportedly remains uncertain with his contract expiring in 2027. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Should you draft Cooper Flagg in the third round?
content: Our experts weigh in on the No. 1 pick of the 2025 NBA draft and what type of fantasy production they expect out of him as a rookie.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Our experts list their picks.

title: 'India, China funding Russia's war': Trump repeats big charge at UNGA meet - Top quotes
content: President Trump, addressing the UN General Assembly, declared a "Golden Age of America," highlighting the nation's economic and military strength. He criticized the UN's lack of support in his diplomatic efforts to end wars, questioning its purpose and effectiveness. Trump emphasized America's unparalleled position globally, citing its strong economy, borders, military, and international relationships.

title: 'Two things I got': Trump mocks UN over broken escalator, teleprompter
content: During his UN visit, President Trump encountered a malfunctioning escalator and a faulty teleprompter, prompting him to mock the organization. He used these incidents to highlight his broader criticisms of the UN, joking about the quality of their equipment. Trump also revisited his past attempt to renovate the UN headquarters, expressing dissatisfaction with the chosen flooring.

title: UNGA meet: US foils plot to cripple NYC telecom network; 100k SIMs seized
content: Ahead of the United Nation General Assembly, US Secret Service and NYPD took down a device network. This network operated in the tri-state area. It could cripple telecom systems. Over 300 SIM card servers and 100,000 SIM cards were recovered. These devices could conduct telecommunications attacks. The devices were near the UN General Assembly.

title: JP Morgan CEO Jamie Dimon says H-1B visa fee hike came out of the blue
content: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon expressed surprise at the sudden H-1B visa fee hike implemented by the Trump administration, emphasizing the visa's importance for global talent mobility within the bank. Dimon highlighted the US as an immigrant nation, advocating for merit-based immigration and indicating that businesses will engage with the government to address concerns arising from the new fee.

title: 'Aarti for Asaram Bapu': Hospital staff caught worshipping convicted rapist - Video
content: A controversy erupted at Surat’s New Civil Hospital after staff members were filmed performing an aarti and paying respects to a photograph of Asaram Bapu, a convicted rapist. The incident, which took place at the stem cell building's entrance, led to the removal of a security guard and a Class 1 officer.

title: 'Dr' Trump, Tylenol, and why Americans don't trust the 'science'
content: Tylenol, or to use its generic name paracetamol, was in the news recently when Donald Trump suddenly put on his ‘Doctor’ cap and claimed that acetaminophen, the active ingredient in Tylenol, was causing autism, warned pregnant women to avoid the drug, and said the USFDA would include warnings for its use — much to the chagrin of scientific consensus. The problem, however, is that Americans no longer ‘trust the science’. Much like with the Democrats, Americans have had a very messy break-up with scientific consensus — and some of it is thanks to “Dr” Trump, but also because of the mendacious propaganda that passed itself off as science.

title: Lottery system out? Trump may overhaul H-1B selection process; what's the new criteria
content: The Trump administration has proposed H-1B visa modifications, prioritizing higher-skilled, better-compensated workers through a weighted selection process based on wage levels. This shift from a random lottery aims to incentivize better compensation and advanced qualifications.

title: ‘We need the brightest minds’: Nvidia, OpenAI CEO defend H‑1B fee; warns US
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman have both criticized the recent H-1B visa fee hike, emphasizing the importance of attracting global talent to the U.S. and supporting the American Dream. Their comments come as Nvidia announces a significant $100 billion investment in OpenAI, highlighting the demand for skilled workers in AI and chipmaking.

title: Ex-NFL star Rudi Johnson dies at 45: Battled CTE and mental health; legacy mourned
content: Rudi Johnson, ex-Cincinnati Bengals running back, passed away at 45. He died earlier this week. The cause of death is unknown. Johnson struggled with mental health and CTE effects. He played for Bengals and Detroit Lions. Johnson played college football at Auburn University. He started the Rudi Johnson Foundation. His death shocked teammates and fans. He helped many people.

title: First reaction OUT! Team India responds to Haris Rauf’s controversial behaviour
content: Pakistani pacer Haris Rauf faced backlash after gesturing towards Indian fans during Pakistan's defeat in the Asia Cup Super Fours clash. Rauf's gesture, referencing unsubstantiated claims of downing Indian jets, went viral and drew criticism.

title: Watch: Stopped by NYC police, French prez calls Trump
content: During the UN General Assembly session in New York City, French President Emmanuel Macron's convoy was halted due to traffic restrictions implemented for US President Donald Trump's motorcade. A video shows Macron waiting on the sidewalk, with a New York police officer apologizing for the delay.

title: H-1B visa fee hike: Elon Musk recalls his journey; Says ‘I’m in America via H-1B’
content: Amidst a significant H-1B visa fee hike causing turmoil in the tech sector, an old post from Elon Musk defending the visa program has resurfaced. Musk previously credited H-1B visas for his success and America's tech dominance, vowing to fiercely protect the system. This resurfacing occurs as Indian professionals face potential layoffs and relocation due to the new fees.

title: 'Wish some people grow up': Tewari after BJP uses his 'dynast' post to target Rahul
content: Congress MP Manish Tewari's remarks about youth-led protests against entitlement in South Asia have sparked a political row. The BJP interpreted Tewari's comments as a dig at Rahul Gandhi, labeling him the "ultimate nepo kid." Tewari countered, urging the BJP to focus on the serious national security implications of the regional unrest, while defending his statement.

title: Brain-eating amoeba: Kerala reports 80 cases; 21 dead
content: Kerala has reported 80 cases and 21 deaths due to Primary Amoebic Meningoencephalitis (PAM), a rare and fatal brain infection caused by Naegleria fowleri. The state health minister Veena George mentioned that the cause of encephalitis cases is still unknown. However, Kerala has developed testing facilities in all microbiology labs and issued guidelines in 2024 for early detection and treatment.

title: Pak to make final on Sept 28? Fans predict another humiliation vs India
content: After a shaky start in the Super 4s and plagued by off-field issues, Pakistan face Sri Lanka in a must-win Asia Cup clash. A heavy defeat to India has further dented their confidence, adding pressure after an inconsistent group stage. With fan frustration mounting, Pakistan need a victory to revive their campaign and avoid another potential humiliation.

title: Kolkata rain chaos: 8 dead, city paralysed; schools shut - key developments
content: Kolkata is grappling with severe flooding after record rainfall, leading to eight electrocution deaths and widespread disruption. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has blamed poor dredging and the CESC for the crisis, announcing advanced Puja holidays and virtual inaugurations.

title: Quincy Olivari seals deal: Joins Detroit Pistons; ready for 2025-26 season
content: Quincy Olivari, the undrafted rookie previously with the Los Angeles Lakers, has agreed to a training camp deal with the Detroit Pistons, confirmed by Darrel Comer of CSE Talent. Waived by the Lakers in January 2025, Olivari now has an opportunity to secure a roster spot or a two-way contract with the Pistons.

title: 'Vaccines don’t cause autism’: WHO debunks Trump’s Tylenol–paracetamol claims
content: The World Health Organisation refuted claims made by US President Donald Trump regarding autism, clarifying that neither Tylenol (paracetamol) nor vaccines are causative factors. WHO emphasized the safety and life-saving impact of childhood immunization schedules, which have prevented 154 million deaths in the last 50 years.

title: Maha shocker: BJP workers make Cong leader wear sari over PM photo; oppn fumes
content: A political controversy erupted in Dombivli after a Congress worker shared a morphed image of Prime Minister Modi in a sari, triggering strong condemnation from BJP cadres. BJP workers allegedly retaliated by forcing the Congress worker to wear a sari, leading to protests and clashes between the two parties.

title: Jason Kelce shines: Sax solo for Ravens pregame; fans love the surprise
content: Jason Kelce, the retired Philadelphia Eagles center, delighted fans by joining the Baltimore Ravens' pregame band, showcasing his saxophone skills in full uniform. His brother, Travis Kelce, shared his excitement on social media. Kelce's musical background, dating back to high school, has always been a significant part of his life, influencing his success in sports and beyond.

title: 'Same mentality': Yogi likens Swadeshi critics to 'invaders', backs PM Modi's 'Made in India' push
content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has intensified his support for the Centre's 'Swadeshi campaign', criticizing those allegedly dividing society and opposing the initiative. He highlighted PM Modi's call for 'Atmanirbhar Bharat', urging citizens to prioritize 'Made in India' products to boost the economy and support local businesses.

title: 'I'm the fraud': Shoaib Akhtar attacks Pak coach; calls his coaching 'senseless'
content: Following Pakistan's defeat to India in the Asia Cup 2025, Shoaib Akhtar strongly criticized coach Mike Hesson's selection decisions, particularly the inclusion of Hussain Talat. Akhtar questioned Talat's utility in such a crucial match, highlighting his slow innings that stalled Pakistan's momentum. Akhtar also expressed his approach to fixing Pakistan cricket, emphasizing teamwork, logic, and consistent backing of young players.

title: UP NEET PG counselling 2025: 148 candidates debarred for seat withdrawal
content: UP NEET PG counselling 2025: The DGME Uttar Pradesh has debarred 148 candidates from the UP NEET PG counselling 2025 for failing to join or resigning from their MD and MS seats during previous stray vacancy rounds. Candidates who do not complete the admission process face security deposit forfeiture and disqualification for the next session. The counselling schedule and security deposit details will soon be released on the official website for MD, MS, Diploma, DNB, and MDS courses.

title: 'Stop this terrorist': As Rubio meets Syria prez, old US embassy post goes viral
content: A US Embassy post once labeled the Syrian President a wanted terrorist. Now, Marco Rubio met Ahmed al-Sharaa to discuss US priorities in Syria. They talked about counterterrorism and Israel-Syria relations. Donald Trump also met Sharaa earlier in Saudi Arabia. This marked the first meeting between leaders in 25 years.

title: US visa row: Lawmakers move to protect 'dreamers'; lifeline for 1.34 lakh Indian kids
content: A bipartisan group of US lawmakers has reintroduced the America's Children Act, aiming to provide a pathway to citizenship for over 250,000 'documented dreamers' who face deportation upon turning 21. The bill seeks to address the issue of children aging out of their parents' visas, particularly impacting the Indian diaspora due to green card backlogs.

title: Kirk shooting fallout: Olbermann attacks Stephen Smith; shocking claim sparks feud
content: Keith Olbermann ignited a feud with Stephen A. Smith, accusing him of right-wing pandering after Smith questioned Jimmy Kimmel's joke about the late Charlie Kirk. Olbermann defended Kimmel's comment, which mocked the "MAGA gang," and criticized Disney's decision to suspend Kimmel. The controversy arose following Kirk's tragic death in a shooting at Utah Valley University.

title: 'Safe living here': American woman praises India; lauds low hospital bill
content: The healthcare system in India provides affordable medical services, according to Kristen's personal experience. Generally speaking, medical infrastructure in India operates at lower prices, which makes healthcare accessible to most residents

title: ‘Seemanchal Nyay Yatra’: Owaisi to launch AIMIM’s 4-day campaign in Bihar from Sept 24
content: Asaduddin Owaisi, the AIMIM president, is set to launch his party's Bihar Assembly election campaign with a four-day "Seemanchal Nyay Yatra" from September 24-27, focusing on the Seemanchal region. The Yatra aims to unite people for the development of the backward region, with Owaisi criticizing the BJP's caste politics. In the 2020 elections, AIMIM won five seats from Seemanchal and plans to contest more in 2025.

title: 'You gotta lose more weight': Cormier’s Olympic heartbreak; UFC champ’s near medal
content: Daniel Cormier, a former UFC champion, almost won an Olympic medal. He competed in wrestling but missed the bronze. Later, drug testing raised hopes, but it stopped too soon. Cormier also recounts nearly losing his UFC title due to weight issues. His teammate, Luke Rockhold, influenced a decision that almost cost him the fight. Cormier managed to retain his title.

title: Delhi: Over 150 report sick after consuming kuttu atta in Jahangirpuri
content: In northwest Delhi, approximately 200 individuals have reportedly fallen ill due to suspected food poisoning linked to buckwheat flour consumption during Navratri fasting. Authorities were alerted early Tuesday morning, with affected individuals from areas like Jahangirpuri seeking treatment at BJRM Hospital.

title: J&K: Soldier dies in Udhampur after gunshot; probe under way
content: In Udhampur, Jammu and Kashmir, a soldier tragically died from a gunshot wound sustained from his own service rifle outside a military hospital on Tuesday. The soldier, a driver, was waiting in a vehicle when the incident occurred.

title: 'Roads near PM Modi's house also have potholes': DKS to IT companies in Bengaluru
content: Deputy CM D K Shivakumar addresses Karnataka's pothole issue, stating it's a nationwide problem, not unique to the state, and the government is actively working on repairs. He criticizes the BJP's past inaction and accuses them of politicizing the issue ahead of elections. His remarks follow concerns raised by industry leaders and a planned BJP road blockade protest.

title: Think 63 to retire: Hidden financial dangers; experts reveal smarter age
content: Many Americans aim for early retirement around 63, but financial experts advise caution. Retiring too early can lead to reduced Social Security benefits, higher healthcare costs before Medicare, and the risk of outliving savings. Delaying retirement until 65-67 offers increased financial security through higher benefits and Medicare eligibility, ensuring a more stable and enjoyable post-work life.

title: ‘Matter of relief & joy’: Akhilesh Yadav welcomes Azam Khan’s release from jail
content: Akhilesh Yadav expressed relief and gratitude for Azam Khan's release from Sitapur jail, criticizing the BJP for filing false cases. Shivpal Singh Yadav echoed these sentiments, asserting the Samajwadi Party's unwavering support for Khan. After nearly two years in custody facing numerous charges, Khan's release was met with large gatherings of supporters.

title: ‘I did it out of curiosity’: Afghan teen hides in plane’s gear; lands in Delhi
content: A 13-year-old Afghan boy was discovered at Delhi airport after stowing away in the landing gear compartment of a Kam Air flight from Kabul. The boy, who claimed he acted out of curiosity, was found after the flight landed and was questioned by security.

title: Fact check: Does Ind vs Pak third umpire have IPL contract as claimed by ex-players?
content: The dismissal of Fakhar Zaman during the India vs Pakistan Asia Cup match has sparked controversy, with Pakistani players and former cricketers questioning the third umpire's decision. Concerns centre on the legitimacy of Sanju Samson's catch and the limited camera angles used for review. At the heart of the controversy is umpire Ruchira Palliyaguruge of Sri Lanka.

title: Siddaramaiah writes to Azim Premji; seeks Wipro’s support in tackling traffic
content: Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has requested Wipro founder Azim Premji's assistance in alleviating Bengaluru's Outer Ring Road traffic congestion. The appeal follows criticism regarding the city's infrastructure, with the CM suggesting limited vehicular access through Wipro's campus could reduce congestion by 30%.

title: Peacocks and protests: Rahul links unemployment to 'vote chori'; takes jibe at PM Modi
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized the Modi government, linking rising unemployment and corruption to alleged electoral malpractices. He accused the BJP of prioritizing image management and corporate interests over youth employment, highlighting a split-screen video contrasting police action against protesting students with the Prime Minister's public relations activities. Gandhi asserted that young Indians will no longer tolerate "job theft" or "vote theft."

title: Movie tickets to not cost more than Rs 200? K'taka HC says no; stays state govt order
content: The Karnataka High Court has temporarily suspended the state government's order that capped cinema ticket prices at Rs 200. This decision follows petitions from multiplexes, theatre owners, and film producers who argued the cap was arbitrary and detrimental to their business. The court's intervention puts the price regulation on hold, pending further deliberation on its validity and impact.

title: Zubeen Garg's death: Why Assam govt ordered 2nd autopsy?
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma announced a second autopsy for Zubeen Garg, responding to public demand and his family's consent, following his death in Singapore. A holiday is declared in Kamrup (Metro) for his cremation. The post-mortem will be at GMCH, with AIIMS doctors present. The state will live-stream the funeral and construct memorials.

title: 'Afridi treated like net-ball spinner': Gavaskar hails India's match-winner
content: Sunil Gavaskar praised Tilak Varma's fearless batting after India's dominant Asia Cup victory over Pakistan. Varma's audacious strokes against Shaheen Shah Afridi sealed the win, leaving Gavaskar impressed. India's strong opening partnership and Pakistan's struggles with the ball further contributed to India's commanding performance, positioning them favourably in the Super 4 standings.

title: Russia Says It Would Be Risky To Allow Nuclear Treaty With US To Lapse
content: The Kremlin said on Tuesday that allowing the New START nuclear treaty with the United States to expire next February would be fraught with risks for international security.

title: Lucknow Man Beaten To Death Over Interfaith Relationship, 2 Held
content: A 26-year-old man was allegedly beaten to death by three neighbours over his suspected interfaith relationship in Lucknow's Saadatganj area, police said on Tuesday.

title: Video: Macron Stopped In New York To Make Way For Trump's Motorcade
content: French President Emmanuel Macron and his entourage had to wait as the police cleared the New York streets for US President Donald Trump's convoy.

title: Vaccines, Tylenol Do Not Cause Autism: WHO
content: Neither the painkiller Tylenol nor vaccines have been shown to cause autism, the World Health Organisation said on Tuesday, following comments from the US president and his administration to the contrary.

title: After Objectionable Post On PM, BJP Workers Force Congress Leader Into A Saree
content: A Congress leader from Maharashtra's Ulhasnagar, who had posted a morphed photo of Prime Minister Narendra Modi on social media, was forced into a saree by the local BJP workers.

title: Ladakh's 91-km Hanle-Chumar Road Open For Public: Army
content: The 91-kilometre strategic road connecting Hanle to the border village of Chumar in Ladakh has been thrown open to the public, the Army said on Tuesday.

title: Bihar's Sadaqat Ashram To Host Congress Top Body Meet: Between Memory And Mirage
content: In the languid bends of the Holy Ganga, where the river slows to cradle Patna in its muddy embrace, sits Sadaqat Ashram - an institution that looks less like a fortress of politics.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trump Tariffs May Have An Unlikely Gainer In India - RSS. Here's How
content: The American onslaught on Indian exports and workers has provided the Modi administration an off-ramp to align closer to the RSS swadeshi ideology and perhaps bridge the widest and oldest rift between the RSS and its political arm.

title: Bengaluru Woman Says Husband "Impotent", Demands Rs 2 Crore. He Files FIR
content: Allegations of impotency, harassment and assault have culminated in a police case filed by a man against his wife in Bengaluru.

title: Pahalgam Attack Link, Fake Arrest Warrants: How 68-Year-Old Lost Rs 26 Lakh
content: A senior citizen in Hyderabad was defrauded of Rs 26 lakh after he was tricked into believing that his name has been linked to the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, in which 26 civilians had been killed.

title: Children Most Affected In HMPV Virus Outbreak This Year: Lancet Study
content: A study that looked into trends of the respiratory infection HMPV that broke out in India early this year has found that children were the most affected, with the highest diagnoses among those aged 1-2.

title: "Hope My Story Serves As Warning": Ex-Banker Loses Rs 23 Crore In Digital Arrest
content: A 78-year-old former banker who lost his life's savings, a whopping Rs 23 crore, to a fake "digital arrest," hopes his loss will serve as a warning to others.

title: Probe Agency Seizes Assets Worth Rs 7.44 Crore Linked To Delhi Ex-Minister
content: The Enforcement Directorate has once again added to the troubles of former Delhi Minister Satyendra Kumar Jain.

title: Around 200 Fall Ill After Consuming Buckwheat Flour In Delhi: Cops
content: Around 200 people have fallen ill due to food poisoning, allegedly after consuming buckwheat flour during Navratri fasting in northwest Delhi, police said on Tuesday.

title: Proper Clothes, Tika, Aadhaar: Bajrang Dal Lays Down Rules For Navratra Garba
content: Signboards, posters and warnings, dos and don'ts on how garba festivities are to be conducted have come up across the cities of Kota and Bhilwara in Rajasthan.

title: Karnataka BJP MP's Wife Loses Rs 14 Lakh Via 'Digital Arrest', Money Recovered
content: In a swift operation, the Bengaluru police have recovered Rs 14 lakh, which BJP Chikkaballapura MP K Sudhakar's wife Preeti had lost in a cyber fraud through 'digital arrest'.

title: Iran Executed Over 1,000 People In 2025, Highest In 17 Years: NGO
content: Iran has executed at least 1,000 people so far in 2025, an NGO said on Tuesday, denouncing a "mass killing campaign" in prisons in the Islamic republic.

title: Indian Origin Executives Appointed CEOs At 2 Major US Companies Amid H-1B Fee Hike
content: Two major US companies have appointed Indian-origin executives as CEOs, days after President Donald Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee hike.

title: Plant my flag list: Greg Wyshynski's 10 must-draft players
content: Greg Wyshynski reveals the 10 players he's queuing up in every one of his fantasy hockey drafts this season.

title: Four-team mock draft strategy: When to draft Tkachuk, Kucherov and others
content: Four-team leagues are rising in popularity, so our experts mock drafted their teams for a H2H points league.

title: Shaquille O'Neal leads NBA 2K26 Old School program
content: 2K Games has introduced the Old School program to NBA 2K26, with Shaquille O'Neal headlining the roster additions for MyTeam. Based on the legend's early days with the  Orlando Magic , the Diamond Pink item sports 96 OVR. O'Neal is joined by 96 OVR Pink Diamond versions of  Dallas Mavericks  star  Kyrie Irving  and women's basketball legend Swin Cash. Cash's pedigree is especially impressive, as she is a three-time WNBA Champion, two-time Olympic gold medal winner and FIBA Women's World Champion. Combined with her two NCAA Women's Champions, she's one of only eleven players to have collected all of these titles. The trio is accompanied by players such as Diamond Tim Duncan and  Pete Maravich , who both sport 94 OVR. Players can obtain Old School items from the program's packs and gain an extra reward for completing the entire collection in the form of a Ruby Jerry Sloan coach card for their team.

title: WWE Raw takeaways: Are Ripley and Sky WWE's new odd couple? Can Vaquer keep ascending?
content: the first Raw after Wrestlepalooza left the landmark event firmly in the rearview mirror, as attention turned to building the card for crown jewel in Perth, Australia, on Oct. 11 . newly minted women's world champion Stephanie Vaquer delivered a heartfelt promo after it was announced she would square off with the winner of this Friday's triple-threat match . the biggest highlight of Raw was in the main event between Rhea Ripley and Asuka, two formidable performers

title: Ten years of Kirby Smart at Georgia
content: a stranger approached a football coach to share a story about her daughter . she stepped outside to hear smart screaming at his players through a microphone during practice . the woman said she felt so much better that she wasn't in football practice, she said .

title: Return of the Mac? Five things we've learned about Jones after latest starting stint

title: No, Indiana football hasn't really beaten anyone, but what if it's for real?

title: Micah Parsons isn't the first player Jerry Jones talked contracts with -- he won't be last
content: it has been a common practice for Jones and executive vice president Stephen Jones over the years to engage with their star players in hopes of convincing them to sign a new deal . there is nothing in the collective bargaining agreement that explicitly prevents the discussions . several agents said it is not a good look to circumvent them and go to the player who might not know all the details .
